meanings.definition: To place or arrange in a proper order or position.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys collocating her books by genre on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: The librarian is collocating the new books with the existing ones.
meanings.sent3: The students had a fun time collocating their toys in a neat row.
meanings.sent4: The chef was collocating the ingredients like a conductor orchestrating a symphony.
meanings.sent5: Collocating the puzzle pieces made the picture come together perfectly.

meanings.definition: To occur in conjunction with something else.
meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm is collocating with heavy rain tonight.
meanings.sent2: The festival will be collocating with the local fair this weekend.
meanings.sent3: The cat seems to be collocating its meows with the sound of the piano.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter collocates with the chirping of the birds outside.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks collocating with the music created a magical atmosphere.
